segment.source: How to use the Additional Settings page in IEAK 11 Customization Wizard for additional settings that relate to your employee’s desktop, operating system, and security.
segment.target: How to use the Additional Settings page in IEAK 11 Customization Wizard for additional settings that relate to your employee’s desktop, operating system, and security.

segment.source: Use the Additional Settings page in the IEAK 11 Wizard (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: Use the Additional Settings page in the IEAK 11 Wizard (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: Use the Additional Settings page in the IEAK 11 Wizard
segment.target: Use the Additional Settings page in the IEAK 11 Wizard

segment.source: The Additional Settings page of the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK 11) Customization Wizard lets you pick additional custom, corporate, and Internet settings that relate to your employee’s desktop, operating system, and security.
segment.target: The Additional Settings page of the Internet Explorer Administration Kit (IEAK 11) Customization Wizard lets you pick additional custom, corporate, and Internet settings that relate to your employee’s desktop, operating system, and security.

segment.source: If you don’t change a setting, it’ll be ignored.
segment.target: If you don’t change a setting, it’ll be ignored.

segment.source: The additional settings appear in administration (.adm) files that are stored in your folder.
segment.target: The additional settings appear in administration (.adm) files that are stored in your folder.

segment.source: You can also create your own .adm files with options that can be configured using the wizard.
segment.target: You can also create your own .adm files with options that can be configured using the wizard.

segment.source: Any edits you make to your own .adm file are stored as .ins files, which are used to build the .inf files for your custom install package.
segment.target: Any edits you make to your own .adm file are stored as .ins files, which are used to build the .inf files for your custom install package.

segment.source: You can store your user settings in a central location so your employees that log on from computer to computer can use them.
segment.target: You can store your user settings in a central location so your employees that log on from computer to computer can use them.

segment.source: For example if you have an employee that requires low security using a computer that’s typically operated by someone that needs more restrictive permissions.
segment.target: For example if you have an employee that requires low security using a computer that’s typically operated by someone that needs more restrictive permissions.

segment.source: You’ll only see this page if you are running the Internal version of the IE Customization Wizard 11.
segment.target: You’ll only see this page if you are running the Internal version of the IE Customization Wizard 11.

segment.source: To use the Additional Settings page
segment.target: To use the Additional Settings page

segment.source: Double-click Custom Settings, Corporate Settings, or Internet Settings, and review the included policy or restriction settings.
segment.target: Double-click Custom Settings, Corporate Settings, or Internet Settings, and review the included policy or restriction settings.

segment.source: Pick the setting you want to change, and then update its details.
segment.target: Pick the setting you want to change, and then update its details.

segment.source: Click Next to go to the Wizard Complete-Next Steps page or Back to go to the Programs page.
segment.target: Click Next to go to the Wizard Complete-Next Steps page or Back to go to the Programs page.
